metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29154 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in rsync before 3.2.5 that allows malicious remoteservers to write arbitrary files inside the directories of connectingpeers. The server chooses which files/directories are sent to the client.However, the rsync client performs insufficient validation of file names. Amalicious rsync server (or Man-in-The-Middle attacker) can overwritearbitrary files in the rsync client target directory and subdirectories(for example, overwrite the .ssh/authorized_keys file).

criterions.comment: rsync: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
